title: Swedish Speaking Content Editor (iGaming)
description:
**Swedish Speaking Content Editor**
* Remote
* Permanent or Full-time Contractor
* Competitive Package


**About Us**
 ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.
   

  

**What Makes Us Different**
 At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are excited to be on the hunt for a talented and motivated individual to join our team as a Swedish-speaking Content Editor.
   

  

 In this role, you will create, edit, and optimize engaging casino or sports betting content, ensuring high quality, SEO compliance, and accuracy while collaborating daily with editors and team members to support content strategy, project success, and steady content production.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Edit and publish written content using WordPress
* Build content briefs across a range of topics with thorough keyword and competitor analysis
* Daily management of in-house or freelance writers, setting deadlines, giving feedback, and setting tasks
* Work closely with the regional Content Manager to manage priorities and workflow
* Review and edit existing content to ensure it meets the editorial standards and SEO guidelines
* Suggest new ideas and content types with data-backed research


**Qualifications**
* 2+ years of proven experience working with content related to the iGaming industry
* Excellent written and spoken skills in English and Swedish. Having an eye for detail is a must
* Familiarity with SEO tools like Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, SEMrush, and SurferSEO
* Proficiency with SEO to the extent that it allows for perfect content optimization
* Previous experience using a CMS (Content Management System) such as WordPress and basic knowledge of HTML is highly beneficial
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills


**Benefits & Rewards**
* A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shine
* An entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)
* Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolio
* Personal responsibility with a ton of autonomy
* 33 free paid days
* An international team with over 35 nationalities
* Fully Remote working
* Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location


**What do we mean by "Fully Remote"**
 Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.
   

  

 Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.
   

  

 Diversity is a given for us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences and cultures we bring together.
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows**
* Apply
* Have an introduction call with our recruitment team
* Have a technical interview
* Do a test


**Equal Opportunities**
 ClickOut Media is an equal opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

title: DevOps Engineer with AWS
description:
DevOps Engineer
  
We are currently looking for a DevOps Engineer that can help us develop and improve services to support our developer teams.
  
At the Boeing office in central Gothenburg, Sweden you will work in a one-of-a-kind software development organization with fascinating solutions that make a real difference to people around the world. You will be working in an agile learning organization, surrounded by a team of talented, creative and dedicated colleagues. You will learn and broaden your perspective by working with 400 professionals from more than 30 different nations, but also be part of a global organization allowing for collaboration with customers and colleagues across the world. Most importantly, you will be expected to make a difference. We are very proud of our culture of trust and helpfulness.
  
The position is with the Voyagers team - a platform team which develops the CICD platform in AWS for DAS. We are today using CICD solutions based on e.g. GitLab, EKS, terraform and more. As a cloud team we are streamlining the on-boarding of developer teams’ SaaS solution.
  
  

**Position responsibilities:**  

Develop and maintain infrastructure in Kubernetes and AWS.
  
Develop and maintain cloud based CICD solutions.
  
Interact with, and support other development teams and developers.
  
  

About the Voyagers team
  
You will be part of a highly qualified and experienced team developing vital structures for our products going into the cloud.
  
Today the Voyagers team is comprised of 8 people.
  
We use tools such as GitLab, terraform, Kubernetes as well as python and bash scripts.
  
We work with Infrastructure as Code.
  
We work tightly within the team, often with pair and mob programming.
  
We are building out the platform in collaboration with Application teams, based on their needs.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Fluency in English (our corporate language), spoken and written.
  
  

**Preferred qualifications:**  

Bachelor Degree in Science or similar experience
  
We believe you have an analytical approach to problem solving, good communication skills both within and outside your team and an interest for technology as well as human relations.
  
We also think you are driven, committed, have a positive attitude and are comfortable with continuous team growth and having fun.
  
  

**We think you have:**  

Experience in cloud technologies, for example AWS services, terraform, EKS, docker and/or similar.
  
Good knowledge and skills in using Linux and scripting in Python, bash etc.
  
Experience and interest in DevOps and DevSecOps.

title: CPO, Customer Solutions, Solna
description:
I'm interested


*Are you passionate about creating digital solutions that truly make a difference? Do you want to lead product development that supports thousands of businesses across the Nordics – every single day? Then this might be the perfect role for you!*

At PostNord, we connect people and businesses reliably and efficiently. As the leading logistics provider in the Nordics, we are constantly evolving our digital customer experience – and the Business Portal is at the heart of that journey. We are now looking for a skilled and forward-thinking Chief Product Owner to join our Business Solutions area within Customer Solutions.


Customer Solutions is one of four Solution Areas within PostNord IT, consisting of around 150 professionals working across multiple teams. We are responsible for all customer-facing products - including the PostNord App, PostNord Business Portal and various customer and Partner APIs. Our product teams manage their products end-to-end, with a strong focus on collaboration, innovation and customer value.


The department is led by Head of Customer Solutions and structured to enable efficient cross-functional teamwork and includes Product Owners, Technical Leads and Designers who work closely together to deliver seamless digital experiences.

  

**About the role**

As Chief Product Owner, you will lead the Business Solution area, which includes four DevOps teams responsible for the PostNord Business Portal. The portal supports our business customers throughout their journey – from onboarding and tracking to customer service, claims, invoices and more.


You will lead and manage a team of Product Owners and their cross-functional teams, with overall responsibility for delivery, budget and team development withing the product area. Together, you drive the product vision and strategy, ensuring alignment with stakeholders across PostNord and our Nordic markets.


In this role, you are also responsible for ensuring that the product area operates with a clear direction and shared goals. With the support of your Product Owners, you oversee ongoing activities, availability and coordination with stakeholders in the countries and other group functions. You will represent the product area in strategic forums, lead the development of vusiness cases and manage volume and cost planning. The role includes both personnel and consultant responsibility and you act as a key spokesperson for the product area in various internal and external contexts.


Collaboration is central to the role, and you will work closely with fellow CPOs within Customer Solutions and across PostNord IT to ensure consistency, innovation and customer value across our digital portfolio.


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

At PostNord, we value our employees and reward them with competitive salaries, great working conditions, and amazing benefits and discounts.


One of the benefits you can enjoy is joining The PostNord Plus personnel foundation, which offers you a wide range of activities and deals in holidays, sports, culture and wellness.


PostNord is a fantastic place to work and grow! We have a diverse and talented team of people who work in different roles and locations across the Nordic region.


We offer the prestigious PostNord Professionals program to help talented employees develop and prepare for senior roles


**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------

We are looking for you who has solid experience as a CPO, Product Manager or similar leadership role, ideally within a customer-focused environment. To succeed in this role, we believe you bring:


* Extensive leadership experience in developing customer-facing digital solutions, with a strong understanding of agile methodologies and product development.
* Ability to lead and grow teams, while driving large-scale and complex initiatives, preferably within digital products and services with short time-to market.
* Experience balancing innovation and operational excellence, including managing both new development and DevOps in high-volume environments.
* A collaborative and humble leadership style, with a focus on coaching, empowerment and creating the right conditions for your teams to succeed.
* Strong decision-making skills, with the ability to navigate complexity and act quickly to maintain momentum and clarity.
* Excellent stakeholder management, with confidence in engaging partners, customers and internal teams to build alignment and drive progress.
* Knowledge of e-commerce and logistics is considered a strong advantage.
* Solid experience working in agile environments, with a deep understanding of iterative development and cross-functional collaboration.


**We offer you**

Joining PostNord means becoming part of a dynamic and innovative team. You'll work in a supportive environment that truly values your contributions, offering generous opportunities for professional growth. Here, you can make a meaningful impact on both our customers' lives and the overall success of our business. In addition to fair employment conditions according to collective agreements, we offer you:


* Flexible hybrid workplace. Watch the film about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**Apply**

You are welcome to submit your application! The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email pontus.brohult@postnord.com.


We look forward to hearing from you!


Read more about our union representatives



**Work with great people**
--------------------------

**Hannes Andersson**
Product Owner


"I had already been working with cross border mail at Arlanda so it was a natural step to further develop and understand the global logistics when jumping aboard Direct Link. The best thing about the role is that there’s so much going on at all time. As the global logistic market is constantly evolving, you need to be able to make quick and sound decisions and have really good communication. Another great thing is the cultural aspect which can be both challenging and rewarding when we’re practically doing business all around the world!"
**Åsa Edde**
Product Owner


"During my many years at PostNord, I have worked with development within the customer meeting area and the technology around it. As a Product Owner in the Analytics & Automation team, I can work with a long-term, strategic perspective and apply new technology to automate and streamline customer meetings and business processes among other things. New technology is changing the entire customer experience and our working methods. PostNord is really at the forefront of advanced, smart solutions. The culture is very innovative, which makes it very inspiring and satisfying to work here. We face the future with innovations. Automation is a very interesting area where I think we will see a rapid development in the future. Working here at PostNord with its history and as a company that so many people can relate to is both challenging and important. I really can´t imagine a more exciting and developing job."
PostNord offers communications and logistics solutions to, from and within the Nordic region. With our expertise and a unique distribution network, we are developing the basis for tomorrow’s communication, e-commerce, distribution and logistics.

  

  

**Accountable** 


We see the bigger picture and take ownership to continuously improve our business and systematically share best practices.
**Brave ❤**


By challenging current situations, we can prioritize effectively and focus on the things that matter the most. We lead a business that is in constant change.
**Committed** 


It is important that we listen, pursuing development and asking each other for feedback. Together we create an inclusive workplace where our people can thrive.

title: BizTalk DevOps Engineer
description:
BizTalk DevOps Engineer sökes!
  
  

Är du en driven och lösningsorienterad tekniker för integration och DevOps?
  
Vi söker nu en BizTalk DevOps Engineer som vill arbeta i en modern miljö med stort fokus på tillförlitliga integrationslösningar och kontinuerlig förbättring.
  
  

**Dina ansvarsområden:**  

Underhålla och vidareutveckla integrationslösningar baserade på BizTalk
  
  

Utveckla och automatisera build- och releasepipelines för BizTalk-applikationer
  
  

Hantera incidenter och genomföra rotorsaksanalyser i produktionsmiljöer
  
  

Övervaka och optimera BizTalk-plattformar
  
  

Utföra uppgraderingar och patchning av plattformen
  
  

**Din kompetens:**  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

Erfarenhet av administration av BizTalk Server
  
  

Kunskap om BT360
  
  

Praktisk erfarenhet av Azure DevOps pipelines, GIT, YAML och PowerShell
  
  

God förståelse för Windows Server och Microsoft SQL Server
  
  

Kännedom om Azure Dashboards och Application Insights
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

En spännande roll i ett team som värdesätter samarbete, utveckling och teknisk kvalitet. Här får du möjlighet att påverka, växa och arbeta med tekniker i framkant – i en verksamhet som verkligen gör skillnad.
  
  

Låter detta som en intressant roll?
  
  

Sök redan i dag så berättar vi mer! Uppdraget är ett visstids konsultuppdrag där du får en projektanställning hos NXT Interim. Vi behöver en ansökan, på svenska, inkluderat CV som matchar vår kunds önskemål. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan då vi behöver komplettera med mer information och anbudstiden är kort.
  
  

NXT Interim och NXT Rekrytering är ett nischat och innovativt företag som är verksamma inom konsult- och rekryteringsbranschen. Vi är verksamma inom HR, IT, ekonomi, sälj och marknad och har 20 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter bl.a. sjukförsäkring, remote-arbetsplatser och flera andra förmåner som förgyller din vardag. Vid projektanställning tillämpar vi kollektivavtal.

title: ASIC Devops Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About the Opportunity:**  

Join our dynamic Design Verification Methodology team, where we develop cutting-edge methodologies and EDA workflows across our global R&D centres in Austin, Stockholm, and Lund. As part of Ericsson Silicon, we specialize in creating advanced ASICs and FPGAs for the latest technology nodes within Ericsson’s 5G telecommunications portfolio. This department offers excellent opportunities for career growth and access to a vast knowledge base.


We are currently seeking enthusiastic New graduates eager to start their career in ASIC design, DevOps, and CI/CD automation. In this role, you will contribute to shaping and optimizing methodologies, EDA workflows, and compute cluster efficiency, playing a key part in adopting industry best practices for high-performance silicon design. This is a fantastic opportunity to grow your skills and make an impact in a cutting-edge engineering environment.

 **What you’ll do:**  

* Assist in designing and maintaining Jenkins review flows, timed/nightly builds, and release automation for silicon development.
* Support optimization of EDA workloads and compute cluster efficiency under guidance.
* Contribute to developing CI/CD pipelines for silicon design and verification.
* Help develop, deploy, and support EDA tool flows in Frontend Design & Verification.
* Learn and participate in implementing AI/ML-driven automation for job scheduling and resource management.
* Identify potential inefficiencies in workflows and tooling with mentorship.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to improve build, test, and deployment processes.
* Assist in maintaining high availability, reliability, and security of CI/CD infrastructure.
 **Skills you bring:**  

* M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Wireless Communication Systems, AI, or a related field.
* Relevant thesis work, internships, or projects showcasing experience with Jenkins, Groovy scripting, and pipeline automation.
* Fundamental understanding of DevOps principles, particularly in hardware/software co-design or silicon development.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or Bash for automation purposes.
* Enthusiasm for working with Kubernetes, Docker, and cloud-based CI/CD tools.
* Familiarity with Git, artifact management, and basic release engineering.
* Strong desire to learn continuous integration methodologies and explore AI/ML applications in DevOps.
* Excellent presentation & communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within distributed teams.
* Self-motivated, driven, and proactive.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: DevOps Engineer, Tbricks Retail \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We offer you an impressive techstack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for asustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcomingspace for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'llbe interested in this opportunity!  

Join our DevOps team where you’ll collaborate on the design, implementation, deployment, and integration of a cutting-edge trading/order management platform. Tbricks Retail team is a part of Equities tribe that provide development and maintenance for cash equity trading within the bank.
**About the role:**
We’re looking for a talented **DevOps Engineer** or **Site Reliability Engineer** to join our team and support the infrastructure behind our **Order Management System (OMS)** — a low-latency, high-performance trading platform connected to several exchanges around the world.
You’ll work closely with our C++ development team to streamline **build pipelines**, improve **deployment automation**, and ensure **robust, scalable, and observable** production environments.
If you’re passionate about automation, performance, and helping development teams move fast without breaking things, this role is for you.
### **Your responsibilities will encompass:**

* Build and maintain **CI/CD pipelines** for building, testing, and deploying C++ applications.
* Automate deployment and configuration of OMS infrastructure across environments (dev, staging, prod).
* Maintain **infrastructure reliability** and performance for trading systems.
* Set up and manage **monitoring**, **alerting**, and **logging** solutions.
* Collaborate with developers to improve build times, test coverage, and release processes.
* Manage infrastructure using tools like **Terraform**, **Ansible**, or similar.
* Work with containers (e.g. **Docker**) and orchestration platforms (e.g. **Kubernetes**).
* Support and improve **Linux-based production environments**.
* Troubleshoot environment and deployment issues with a performance mindset.

### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* Preferably 3+ years of experience in **DevOps, Site Reliability engineering**, or similar roles.
* Strong experience with **CI/CD tools** (e.g. GitLab CI, Jenkins, CircleCI).
* Proficiency with **Linux** systems and shell scripting.
* Hands-on experience with **containerization** (Docker) and preferably orchestration (Kubernetes).
* Experience with infrastructure as code (e.g. **Terraform**, **Ansible**, **Helm**).
* Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools such as **Splunk**, **Prometheus**, **Grafana**, **ELK**, or **Datadog**.
* Scripting skills in languages like **Python**, **Bash**, or **Go**.

### **What we offer:**

* Innovative project with highly motivating colleagues
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Extensive training and learning opportunities

**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.  

  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today. If you have questions about the position, please contact Thomas Erlandsson, at Thomas.erlandsson@seb.se  

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks  

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment  

Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.

  

Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 43,000+ GitHub Stars.

  

At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.

  

By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.

### **What would you do at Prisma?**


You’ll be part of our Prisma Data Platform team which is responsible for Accelerate, Prisma Postgres and the bare metal cloud that those products are built on.

  

To give you a clear idea of what the job could entail, here are some examples of the work we’ve done lately or will start soon:

* Choose and deploy a globally distributed configuration store (like etcd, rqlite) for encrypted authentication to enable global routing for Prisma Postgres.
* Improve automation of our servers with the goal of reducing maintenance overhead and provisioning times.
* Configure, deploy, monitor, and debug a cutting-edge containerization platform that drives both internal and external tooling and services.
* Participate in a shared on-call rotation to help ensure reliability of our systems, with an emphasis on fair scheduling, strong tooling, and a culture that values work-life balance.

### **An Ideal Candidate Profile**

* **8+ years of experience** in infrastructure, DevOps, or platform engineering, operating large-scale systems with a focus on **Linux, networking, and cloud environments**.
* **Experience building and scaling resilient distributed systems** across **bare metal and cloud platforms** (AWS, Cloudflare); strong understanding of **systems architecture and reliability patterns**.
* **Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code** (Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, or similar) and automation practices to manage reproducible, scalable environments.
* **High standards for quality**, ensuring excellence while balancing **pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency -** taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* **Strong communication skills in English**, both written and verbal. Be able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, **give and receive constructive feedback effectively**, and foster collaboration across teams.
* **Deep expertise in Linux server administration and networking**, including provisioning, configuration, maintenance, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and hardening aligned to security best practices. Fluency in Bash and Debian. Kernel-level debugging is advantageous.
* **Strengthen and scale a mature security posture** across Cloud environments, IAM and secrets management, secure networking and zero trust access controls, CI/CD and dependency hygiene, API and application security best practices, and maintain audit readiness.
* **You** **think critically and communicate your reasoning clearly**. You articulate your thoughts in a systematic way, plan effectively, anticipate challenges, and ensure smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.
* Advantageous: **Hands-on programming** experience in Go, Python, or other scripting languages, with an inclination to build tools and automation that improve developer and operator experience.

### **What's it like to work at Prisma?**


You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...

* **... have an ownership mindset.** As a Senior Engineer, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* **... stay nimble.** It's a startup, things change, and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* **... be kind and collaborative.** Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.

### **What's in it for you?**


We put our people first**.** Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.

* An opportunity to **shape Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products**, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications see what we’re building.
* **A Fun and Supportive Team** that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* **Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options**, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* **Fully Remote Work** with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* **Generous Time Off**, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* **Parental Benefits**, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* **Sabbatical Leave**, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* **Mental Health Support**, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* **Tech and Ergonomic Budget** to equip you with the tools you need.
* **Annual Offsites**, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* **Relocation Support**, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* **[US] Health and Pension Benefits**, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.

### **Remote Work**


To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone **GMT -2 to GMT +3** for this position.

### **What is our hiring process like?**

* **Introductory Call** with our Head of Engineering.
* **Take Home Assignment** followed by a Technical Interview based on your submission.
* **System Design Interview** with one of your peer engineers
* **Interview** with our COO.
* **Final Interview** with our CEO.
* **Offer**


The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.


If you believe that this is the right position for you then please send your resume along with any supporting documentation or information to us via the link provided on this page. We typically respond within 7 business days.

  

In line with our *Fair Treatment and Equal Opportunity Policy*, as well as our *Disability Policy*, Prisma follows fair and merit-based hiring practices, ensuring all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, experience, and qualifications. We do not make hiring decisions based on *age*, *race*, *ethnicity, sex, gender identity, parental or caregiver status, trade union membership, disability, religious belief or lack of belief, life expectancy, sexual orientation, genetic information*, or *veteran or military status.*

title: Software System Architect
description:
Explore new technologies. Guide teams. Shape the future of mining.  



Are you a technically skilled, communicative, and forward-thinking architect with a passion for AI, automation, and electrification? At Epiroc, we believe our people are our greatest strength - and in this role, your ability to inspire, guide, and collaborate will be key.  


**Your mission**  

As Software System Architect, you’ll drive the evolution of our system design to meet future demands in intelligent mining solutions. You’ll explore and evaluate new technologies, from theory to practice, and support development teams with architectural guidance and hands-on design. You’ll work in large codebases and contribute to a DevOps-driven environment using C++, Azure, Docker, and CI/CD practices. You’ll collaborate across teams and functions, bringing clarity and structure to complex systems.  



A key part of your role is effective communication, translating technical concepts into actionable design, and working closely with internal and external stakeholders. Experience in automation, 3D simulation, control theory such as path planning, and autonomous navigation is highly valued.  

We also welcome experience and interest in Computer Vision, AI and Machine Learning, especially in applications related to autonomous systems, predictive modeling, and intelligent decision-making.  


**Your profile**  

You have solid experience in system architecture and software development, with a strong technical foundation and a passion for innovation. You’re curious, analytical, and thrive on exploring new technologies. You’re also a skilled communicator who enjoys working with others to solve complex challenges and build scalable, future-ready systems. You are someone who shares knowledge, coach’s others, and fosters a culture of growth and technical excellence.  


**Location and travel**  

This position is based in Örebro, Sweden.  


**Life at Epiroc**  

Join us for a creative, innovative, and diverse workplace. Be part of a team that values Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We offer:  

* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University for skill development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package including flexible working hours and bonuses
* Hybrid workplace (up to 49%)
  


**Application and contact information**  

Submit your application as soon as possible through our online system. The last day to apply is October 26, 2025. We review applications continuously.  



Our recruitment process includes interviews, reference checks, and assessments. We conduct identity checks and drug and alcohol screening to ensure a safe working environment. Expect transparent communication and a fair evaluation of your skills and experience.  


**For questions, contact:**  

Hiring Managers, Cecilia Söderkvist, cecilia.soderkvist@epiroc.com or Julius Jägerskog, julius.jagerskog@epiroc.  

Recruitment Specialist, Maria Tedsjö, maria.tedsjo@external.epiroc.com.  


**It all starts with people.** The world needs metals and minerals for the energy transition and our cities and infrastructure must be developed to serve a growing population. To succeed, we need to speed up the shift towards more sustainable mining and construction industries. We at Epiroc accelerate this transformation, together with customers and business partners in more than 150 countries, by developing and providing innovative and safe equipment, digital solutions, and aftermarket support.

All new thinkers are welcome. We are looking for those who want to develop, grow, and dare to think new. In Epiroc we attract, develop, and retain diverse talent valuing authenticity and unique perspectives, driving our spirit of innovation. We foster an inclusive culture where diversity isn't just a goal but a part of our values and way of working. This is how we do business for a sustainable future. Learn more at www.epiroc.com

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Mpya Sci & Tech är skapat av och för människor som älskar teknik och naturvetenskap. Vi är inte här för att göra något som alla andra gör. Vi tar nischad rekrytering och konsulting till en ny nivå med fokus på kandidatperspektivet. Det är därför vi kallar oss Talent Advisors. Vi tror att de riktiga talangerna är de individer som vågar utvecklas genom hela livet. Med lång erfarenhet och djup kunskap om branschen har vi skapat ett framåtlutat och spetsigt bolag, på vårt sätt.
  
  

På Mpya Sci & Tech tror vi på ett hållbart arbetsliv där vi tillsammans bygger en kultur med genuin delaktighet, ivrig nyfikenhet och möjlighet att få vara sig själv. Kom och utvecklas ihop med oss i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Uppsala. Hos en arbetsgivare i världsklass.
  
  

Do you love science and technology? Do you want to work at a company where you can contribute to innovation and development?
  
  

Then keep reading!
  
  

Mpya Sci & Tech is a company built by engineers – for engineers. We’ve created a workplace where you, as an employee, are always at the center. In everything we do, we strive for a high level of involvement and responsiveness to our employees' thoughts about their future roles and careers. Together, we are building a strong, inclusive, curious, and open-minded culture that offers great opportunities for our team members. We want you to work on assignments that you are passionate about, grow professionally, and maintain a healthy work–life balance.
  
  

**About the role:**  

In this role, you will be employed as a consultant at Mpya Sci & Tech.
  
  

**Your responsibilities may include:**  

•
  
Collaborating in an agile product development process with a focus on DevOps engineering
  
  

•
  
Designing, coding, and implementing software features for upcoming products
  
  

•
  
Troubleshooting issues across the Linux stack, from kernel drivers to user applications
  
  

**Skills and Experience We’re Looking For:**  

To thrive in this role, you should bring a mix of the following skills:
  
  

•
  
Strong experience in CI/CD pipelines, automation, and infrastructure as code
  
  

•
  
Solid knowledge of tools like Jenkins, Git, Docker, Kubernetes, or similar
  
  

•
  
6+ years of experience in DevOps engineering or related fields
  
  

•
  
Experience with cloud platforms as AWS, Azure, or GCP
  
  

•
  
Proficiency in scripting Bash, Python
  
  

•
  
Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and alerting tools
  
  

•
  
Team-oriented with a passion for innovation in a fast-paced environment
  
  

**It’s a bonus if you’re interested in:**  

•
  
Working with container orchestration Kubernetes, Helm
  
  

•
  
Using configuration management tools Ansible, Puppet, Terraform
  
  

•
  
Improving security and compliance in CI/CD processes
  
  

•
  
Building scalable and resilient cloud-native systems
  
  

•
  
Driving DevOps culture and best practices within teams
  
  

If you're ready to shape the future of DevOps engineering and technology, we’d love to meet you for an interview.
  
  

Who are we?
  
At Mpya Sci & Tech, we believe in a sustainable working life, and we’re building a culture where you can:
  
  

•
  
Be Dedicated
  
  

•
  
Be Brave and Curious
  
  

•
  
Be Inclusive and Allowing
  
  

We believe that real talent lies in those who dare to keep growing throughout life. With deep industry knowledge and years of experience, we’ve built a forward-thinking company – in our own way.
  
  

**Application:**  

Does this sound like the opportunity you’ve been waiting for? Please go ahead and apply!
  
  

For questions about the position, feel free to contact Talent Advisor Christian Billberg at christian.billberg@mpyascitech.com

title: AI Orchestration Engineer
description:
### **Join Simployer as an AI Orchestration Engineer**



We’re on the lookout for an AI orchestration engineer to help move our software development to a cutting edge AI-powered development practice. As an AI orchestration engineer you will work as an individual contributor leveraging AI models or AI developers/bots and tools to design, develop, and maintain software solutions at greater scale than feasible as a single “traditional” developer. All while ensuring quality, efficiency, and alignment with business objectives of the produced code.



This role is ideal for an experienced developer ready to lead the shift toward AI-driven development both by applying AI hands-on in coding and by championing its adoption across the organization as an early adopter.


### **What you’ll do:**


* Break down product requirements for new features or changes to our products into actionable tasks that can be effectively delegated to AI systems, craft, refine, and iterate prompts or instructions to AI tools for generating code, designs, or other software artifacts.
* Utilize and orchestrate AI models/AI developers & bots to produce software components, scripts, and features, likely by having multiple “AI developers” flows working in parallel in an orchestrated fashion.
* Work closely with product managers, designers, and stakeholders to ensure AI-developed solutions align with product vision and user requirements.
* Review, validate, and debug AI-generated code to ensure it meets quality standards, follows best practices, and aligns with organizational guidelines.
* Evaluate, recommend, and integrate new AI tools, models, and platforms to enhance development processes while maintaining pace of actual development.
* Lead the adoption of AI-driven practices within our development organization and product teams setting the example, evangelizing best practices, and demonstrating the tangible value of applying AI across the software development lifecycle.
* Continuously refine AI orchestration strategies for improved accuracy, efficiency, and scalability, capturing feedback from AI outputs to iteratively improve the orchestration process.
* Ensure AI-generated code adheres to ethical guidelines, respects intellectual property laws, and safeguards sensitive information so that AI tools do not compromise user or organizational data.
* Contribute to system architecture design, ensuring stability and scalability as the product evolves.

  
Skills & Requirements


### **What You Will Bring to the Team:**


* 5+ years of hands-on software development experience, including at least 2 years working with AI tooling and applications.
* Strong grasp of product requirements, user stories, and customer needs, ensuring that solutions delivered truly address and fulfill customer expectations.
* You are extra curious about AI and enjoy experimenting with AI tools and have proven experience finding new ways to improve workflows.
* Willingness to evangelize and influence others in the company to adopt AI development patterns and practices through demos, workshops, hands-on guidance, presentations etc.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.


**Our stack**: Node.js, TypeScript, REST/GraphQL APIs, Unit Testing, Kubernetes, Redis, RabbitMQ, Next.js.


### **What We Offer:**


* A supportive and inclusive workplace where collaboration and personal growth are prioritized.
* The flexibility to work from home or in our Stockholm, Oslo or Sarpsborg office, based on your preference.
* Opportunities for personal and professional development with an emphasis on work-life balance.
* A team that inspires and supports one another in achieving our goals.
* High autonomy and responsibility, with recognition for your unique contributions.

### **Greetings from the Hiring Manager**



Hi, I’m Sebastian, Head of DevEx & DevOps at Simployer. We’re on an exciting mission to transform how we build software by fully embracing AI in our development practices. Over the past year, we’ve accelerated our adoption of AI across our products and teams and now we’re ready to push the boundaries even further. That’s why we’re hiring an AI Orchestration Engineer to help us shape the future of software development.



In this role, you’ll be working at the cutting edge orchestrating AI systems to deliver production-grade solutions, driving experimentation with the newest tools, and setting an example of how AI can dramatically scale developer impact. Beyond building, you’ll also help us elevate engineering culture by evangelizing and guiding AI-powered practices across the company.



If you’re passionate about AI, love solving complex challenges at scale, and want to influence how an entire organization builds software, this is the role for you. I’d love to hear from you. — Sebastian Norling, Head of DevEX & DevOps


**Our Hiring Process:**



* **Introduction meeting:** A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).


* **Personality & Logic Test:** A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs


* **Meet and Greet:** Meet with our Head of DevOps and an HR representative to assess your experience and skills, and for you to learn more about the projects we are working on (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Technical Interview:** A deeper dive into your technical expertise with our tech leaders, and for you to get a better feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Team Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



**We can’t wait to meet you!**



This is more than just a developer role—it’s a chance to help **shape the future of software development**. If you’re excited about working with AI and bringing new ideas to life, we’d love to hear from you! 

  


**Heads-up!** You might think an AI role means bots scan applications at lightning speed — but nope, we’re real humans carefully reviewing each one! This means responses will take a bit longer, but we appreciate your patience and will get back to you ASAP


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values****Learn, Lead and Deliver**With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

* A supportive and inclusive workplace where collaboration and personal growth are prioritized.
* The flexibility to work from home or in our Stockholm, Oslo or Sarpsborg office, based on your preference.
* Opportunities for personal and professional development with an emphasis on work-life balance.
* A team that inspires and supports one another in achieving our goals.
* High autonomy and responsibility, with recognition for your unique contributions.

### **Greetings from the Hiring Manager**



Hi, I’m Sebastian, Head of DevEx & DevOps at Simployer. We’re on an exciting mission to transform how we build software by fully embracing AI in our development practices. Over the past year, we’ve accelerated our adoption of AI across our products and teams and now we’re ready to push the boundaries even further. That’s why we’re hiring an AI Orchestration Engineer to help us shape the future of software development.



In this role, you’ll be working at the cutting edge orchestrating AI systems to deliver production-grade solutions, driving experimentation with the newest tools, and setting an example of how AI can dramatically scale developer impact. Beyond building, you’ll also help us elevate engineering culture by evangelizing and guiding AI-powered practices across the company.



If you’re passionate about AI, love solving complex challenges at scale, and want to influence how an entire organization builds software, this is the role for you. I’d love to hear from you. — Sebastian Norling, Head of DevEX & DevOps


**Our Hiring Process:**



* **Introduction meeting:** A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).


* **Personality & Logic Test:** A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs


* **Meet and Greet:** Meet with our Head of DevOps and an HR representative to assess your experience and skills, and for you to learn more about the projects we are working on (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Technical Interview:** A deeper dive into your technical expertise with our tech leaders, and for you to get a better feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Team Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



**We can’t wait to meet you!**



This is more than just a developer role—it’s a chance to help **shape the future of software development**. If you’re excited about working with AI and bringing new ideas to life, we’d love to hear from you! 

  


**Heads-up!** You might think an AI role means bots scan applications at lightning speed — but nope, we’re real humans carefully reviewing each one! This means responses will take a bit longer, but we appreciate your patience and will get back to you ASAP 


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values****Learn, Lead and Deliver**With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.
  
Leila Safer | Contact Person

title: DevOps Engineer, Tbricks Retail | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We offer you an impressive techstack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for asustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcomingspace for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'llbe interested in this opportunity!
   

  

 Join our DevOps team where you’ll collaborate on the design, implementation, deployment, and integration of a cutting-edge trading/order management platform. Tbricks Retail team is a part of Equities tribe that provide development and maintenance for cash equity trading within the bank.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a talented
 **DevOps Engineer** 
 or
 **Site Reliability Engineer** 
 to join our team and support the infrastructure behind our
 **Order Management System (OMS)** 
 — a low-latency, high-performance trading platform connected to several exchanges around the world.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with our C++ development team to streamline
 **build pipelines** 
 , improve
 **deployment automation** 
 , and ensure
 **robust, scalable, and observable** 
 production environments.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about automation, performance, and helping development teams move fast without breaking things, this role is for you.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Encompass**
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for building, testing, and deploying C++ applications.
* Automate deployment and configuration of OMS infrastructure across environments (dev, staging, prod).
* Maintain infrastructure reliability and performance for trading systems.
* Set up and manage monitoring, alerting, and logging solutions.
* Collaborate with developers to improve build times, test coverage, and release processes.
* Manage infrastructure using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Work with containers (e.g. Docker) and orchestration platforms (e.g. Kubernetes).
* Support and improve Linux-based production environments.
* Troubleshoot environment and deployment issues with a performance mindset.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Preferably 3+ years of experience in DevOps, Site Reliability engineering, or similar roles.
* Strong experience with CI/CD tools (e.g. GitLab CI, Jenkins, CircleCI).
* Proficiency with Linux systems and shell scripting.
* Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker) and preferably orchestration (Kubernetes).
* Experience with infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, Helm).
* Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools such as Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, or Datadog.
* Scripting skills in languages like Python, Bash, or Go.


**What We Offer**
* Innovative project with highly motivating colleagues
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Extensive training and learning opportunities


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today. If you have questions about the position, please contact Thomas Erlandsson, at Thomas.erlandsson@seb.se
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Tech Lead Manager (50/50 Engineering/Leadership)
description:
Are you a senior software engineer who thrives on building the foundational services that power enterprise-scale products? Are you seeking a role that perfectly balances deep, hands-on technical work with impactful people leadership?
   

  

 Sinch is seeking a Tech Lead Manager to guide the Core Services team for our global Voice and Verification platforms. This is a unique 50/50 hybrid role where you will lead a full-stack team responsible for the critical shared components - like billing, accounting, and data flow systems - that our products are built upon. You will be instrumental in shaping our technical landscape and fostering the growth of our people.
   

  

 You will be empowered to drive excellence across two key areas:
   

  

**As a People Leader (50%):**
* Mentor & Develop: Cultivate a high-trust, inclusive engineering culture through dedicated coaching, continuous feedback, and personalised career development plans for each team member.
* Empower & Align: Define clear team objectives, remove obstacles, and ensure your team is motivated, engaged, and aligned with our strategic goals.
* Foster Collaboration: Champion a collaborative environment where continuous learning and shared ownership are paramount.


**As a Hands-On Engineer (50%):**
* Build & Design: Dedicate half your time to designing, coding, and delivering features for our core backend services, leveraging your expertise in technologies like .NET.
* Champion Technical Excellence: Lead by example in code reviews, architectural discussions, and by evangelizing best practices in software craftsmanship.
* Drive Modern Practices: Actively contribute to and improve our DevOps culture, including our CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code, and Kubernetes deployments.


**Requirements**
**We believe the right person for this role will have:**
* Deep Technical Expertise: Extensive hands-on experience in backend development (e.g., .NET, Java), with a history of building scalable, production-grade systems on cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* A Passion for Leadership: Demonstrable experience in a formal or informal leadership capacity (e.g., as a manager, team lead, or senior mentor) and a genuine desire to help engineers grow their careers.
* Exceptional Communication: The ability to articulate complex technical ideas clearly in English, build consensus, and inspire a team toward a common goal.
* A Servant-Leader Mindset: You are proactive, collaborative, and view your primary role as enabling your team to do its best work.


**What Success Looks Like**
* Within 3 Months, You'll... have built strong relationships with your team, shipped your first significant piece of code, and established a solid partnership with your Product Manager to align on the roadmap.
* Within 6 Months, You'll... be leading the delivery of a key team project, have established a cadence of meaningful career conversations, and be driving an initiative to improve your team's technical operations.
* Within 1 Year, You'll... be a trusted and indispensable leader, having demonstrably improved both your team's health and the quality of its technical deliverables while contributing to the strategic roadmap.


**Benefits**
* A True Hybrid Role: This isn't a manager who occasionally codes. We are committed to the 50/50 split, ensuring you remain deeply technical.
* Autonomy and Impact: We hire smart people and trust them. You'll have the autonomy to shape your team, its culture, and its technology.
* A Clear Growth Path: We are invested in your transition into management and will provide the support and opportunities for you to grow as a leader.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren Cloud Engineer som trivs med att kombinera strategi och hands-on arbete i moderna molnplattformar? Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i en organisation där du får påverka arkitektur, säkerhet och framtidens IT-infrastruktur? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som Cloud Engineer hos oss blir du en central del av IT-organisationen med fokus på att utveckla, förvalta och säkra våra molnbaserade plattformar. Rollen är både teknisk och strategisk – du kommer att arbeta praktiskt i miljöerna samtidigt som du tar ett helhetsansvar för arkitektur och riktlinjer.
   

  

 Du kommer driva arbetet med att modernisera vår infrastruktur, stärka säkerheten och skapa stabila, skalbara lösningar i Azure och gärna även AWS.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Designa, bygga och förvalta lösningar i Microsoft Azure (IaaS/PaaS) och gärna även AWS
* Administrera och vidareutveckla Entra ID (Azure AD), inklusive identitets- och åtkomsthantering
* Hantera och optimera Microsoft 365-miljöer med fokus på drift, säkerhet och integrationer
* Arbeta med molnnätverk (vNET, routing, säkerhetszoner, hybridkopplingar)
* Driva initiativ inom molnsäkerhet, både för infrastruktur, applikationer och endpoints
* Ta fram arkitekturella riktlinjer och best practices för molnlösningar
* Samarbeta nära kollegor inom utveckling, drift och säkerhet för att skapa en helhet i IT-landskapet
* Delta i Incident-, Problem- och Change Management-processer


**Din profil:**
**Teknisk kompetens**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Azure infrastruktur (IaaS/PaaS)
* God erfarenhet av Entra ID / Azure AD, identiteter, federationer och säkerhetslösningar
* Djup kunskap i Microsoft 365 (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, Security & Compliance)
* Förståelse för molnnätverk: vNET, VPN, routing, hybridlösningar
* Erfarenhet av molnsäkerhet (Zero Trust, endpoint-skydd, IAM, compliance)
* Erfarenhet av AWS är meriterande
* Skriptkunskaper i PowerShell, Bash eller Python ses som ett plus


**Meriterande**
* Certifieringar inom Azure (t.ex. AZ-104, AZ-305) eller AWS
* Erfarenhet av M365-säkerhet och compliance-verktyg
* Kunskap om containerteknologier (Docker, Kubernetes)


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi tror att du är en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att ta ansvar och skapa ordning i komplexa miljöer. Du kommunicerar tydligt, samarbetar gärna tvärfunktionellt och har förmågan att växla mellan hands-on arbete och strategiskt tänk.
   

  

 Du är dessutom nyfiken på ny teknik och vill bidra till ständig utveckling av våra molnlösningar.
   

  

**Språk**
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

title: Test Infrastructure Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  





 The Role:
 



  





 Yubico is seeking a Test Infrastructure Engineer to join our Firmware team. We're looking for someone with a passion for security to join us to take on a variety of responsibilities that include developing and maintaining a Python-based test automation system, a pytest-based testing framework, and programs and scripts for orchestrating interactions between both physical and simulated hardware devices across various communication interfaces.
 



  





  






  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Develop and maintain scripts for test automation systems
* Build, install and maintain secure infrastructure, test benches and custom hardware test rigs
* Incorporate automated tests into continuous integration (CI) workflows, analyze results and resolve test failures
* Configure and maintain GitLab CI and other tools to support test pipelines
* Ensure reproducibility and reliability across test environments
* Monitor and optimize test execution performance
* Collaborate on a day-to-day basis with firmware, hardware, and infrastructure engineers



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Python
* Test automation frameworks (e.g. pytest)
* CI/CD administration (GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions, etc.)
* Linux server administration
* Git
* Containers (Docker, cgroups, namespaces)



  




**Preferred:** 
* Interfacing embedded systems
* Basic use of electronics lab tools (multimeters, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers)
* C programming






  




  


 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Data Platform Engineer – AWS
description:
🚀 We’re hiring at TATA Technologies Sweden!
 



 Are you passionate about building scalable data platforms and enabling data-driven decisions?
 



 Tata Technologies Nordics AB is looking for a Data Platform Engineer to design, implement, and manage a modern data storage and analytics platform on AWS.
 



  





 Data Platform Engineer – AWS | Data Storage & Analytics
 



 We’re looking for a Data Platform Engineer to design, implement, and manage a modern data storage and analytics platform. You’ll build scalable data pipelines, structure data for analysis, and enable both technical and non-technical users to uncover insights through intuitive data exploration and visualization tools.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


1. Design and deploy ETL/ELT pipelines for seamless data ingestion, transformation, and loading.
2. Connect and integrate data from Amazon RDS clusters and other sources into a unified data warehouse.
3. Develop reliable and automated data flows to convert raw data into business-ready insights.
4. Ensure data quality, consistency, and documentation of data models and transformations.
5. Structure and model data to support self-service analytics for business and technical teams.
6. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.



  





 What We’re Looking For
 


1. Proven experience in data engineering, data warehousing, or analytics platform development.
2. Strong hands-on knowledge of AWS services (e.g., RDS, Lambda, ECS, S3, Glue, Redshift, or Athena).
3. Proficiency in .NET Core and Entity Framework (EF) Core for integration and data application development.
4. Experience with Docker and containerized environments.
5. Familiarity with agile development methods and CI/CD workflows.
6. A mindset for scalability, performance, and automation.



  





 Nice to Have
 


1. Exposure to data visualization tools (Power BI, QuickSight, Tableau, etc.)
2. Experience building or maintaining data lakes and data warehouses in AWS
3. Strong understanding of integration development and APIs

title: Founding Engineer
description:
**About Epiminds 💡** 




  





 Epiminds is redefining the future of marketing with the first AI Operating System, a multi-agent ecosystem built to master every marketing function and run campaigns autonomously from end to end.
 



  





 In just 4 months, we’ve gone from idea to 17 paying clients managing 260 brands on our platform. Backed by two funding rounds, including a seed led by Lightspeed, we’re setting the foundation for the future of autonomous marketing 🚀
 



  





**The Role:** 




  





 We’re looking for a Founding Engineer who thrives at the intersection of machine learning, infrastructure, and product engineering. You’ll work directly with the founders to shape the core product and set the technical direction from the ground up.
 



  





 This is not a “wait for tickets” role. You’ll be building agentic systems, owning infrastructure, and shipping customer-facing features that marketing teams will depend on.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 




  




* Architect and build the first versions of our agentic systems and AI infrastructure.
* Develop customer-facing features, with full-stack skills being a strong plus.
* Work closely with the founders to define and iterate on product vision.
* Push forward experiments in ML fine-tuning, data filtration, and automation.
* Lay the foundations for technical excellence, scalability, and speed.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




  




* Strong background in machine learning, agentic systems, or infrastructure engineering.
* Experience with full-stack product development (React/Node/Python or similar).
* Ability to operate autonomously in a high-intensity, fast-moving environment.
* Exposure to marketing tech, analytics, or commercial workflows.
* Excitement about building from scratch, with ownership of both tech and product.



  





**Culture:** 




  





 Epiminds is an early-stage company with a high-intensity culture. We’re moving fast, shipping fast, and learning fast. If you’re motivated by building something from zero to one with ambition and resilience, you’ll fit right in.
 



  





**Why Join Us 🎯** 




  




* Be a founding engineer at an early-stage AI company backed by one of the world’s leading VCs.
* Work directly with the founders on core product and strategy.
* Help define not just the product, but also the culture, pace, and trajectory of the company.
* Competitive salary with early equity upside.
